item.title: Trump administration cuts most USAID programs. And, the ethics of leaving your job
item.description: Nearly all USAID programs have been eliminated. One official says it's a "global health massacre." And, a federal judge will hear arguments over the decision to fire thousands of probationary workers.

item.title: Thailand deports dozens of Uyghurs to China, activists say
item.description: The detainees were part of a group of some 300 Uyghurs who fled China and were arrested in Thailand in 2014. Thailand deported more than 100 of them to China in 2015, drawing condemnation.

item.title: A rare 'parade' of all 7 planets will move across the night sky this week
item.description: This phenomenon known as a "planet parade," will feature Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune all present at the same time along a line in the night sky on Friday, NASA says.

item.title: How tariffs are (and aren't) the new 'infrastructure week'
item.description: Little about how Trump discusses tariffs is normal — not only because he threatens tariffs on a weekly, even daily, basis, but also because it's often unclear if or when those tariffs will happen.

item.title: Taiwan condemns China for conducting shooting drills off its coast
item.description: Taiwan said in a 24-hour period it detected 45 aircraft, 14 navy vessels and one ship from the Chinese military operating around Taiwan, of which 34 had crossed into its waters and airspace.
